thread.section_title: Finance & Economy – News from shipping finance, major banks and the world economy
thread.title: SteathGas Weekly Market Report

author: shippingherald.com
title: SteathGas Weekly Market Report
text:
The NWE spot coaster market this week showed signs of waning activity especially at the beginning of the week with fewer enquiries and fixtures seen but towards the end the market seemed tighter. As reported tonnage availabilities have gotten shorter, but there were a couple of open prompt vessels around ARA, especially on the smaller sized vessels side. As far as freight rates are concerned they were reportedly under some upward pressure this week reflecting the slight increase in activity. Looking at each market separately now, in the propane coaster market activity remains the quieter of the two. As reported there were the typical exports reported ex UK for delivery N. France and ARA. On the butane coaster side, there was the usual demand reported with cargoes ex East Coast UK and Scandinavia towards ARA and N. France.
Moving on to the MED, activity here was reportedly balanced his week with a few enquiries and fixtures completed but nothing very significant to report. As far as vessel availabilities are concerned there are still a few open prompt vessels in the area looking for employment, mainly on the smaller sized vessels side. In the Black Sea region, activity remains on the quiet side as well with the occasional fixture here and there. The propane coaster market remains unchanged with an inactive spot market and no significant inland demand reported. On the butane coaster market side, activity here was reportedly healthier with more traders seen in the market for tons but availabilities have been limited.
SEA/FEAST
In the Feast pressurized spot lpg market, activity remains on the quiet side this week as well with traders seeming rather balanced and are more or less in the market to fill gaps in their current schedules. Furthermore according to reports, the Sri Lanka lpg tender was awarded to a European trader and delivery into Colombo is expected to commence in beg August. Lastly, in China prices have decreased and owners are reportedly more interested in covering inland demand rather than exporting at the moment.The Asian petchem market this week remains on the quiet side and vessel availability remains rather long. In ppl, the market is somewhat quiet with prices under pressure and suitable vessels rather rare. Also the unplanned shutdowns at plants in Japan and Korea will most likely have an impact on activities throughout July. In the C4 market, Btd has seen prices increase significantly as supplies are reportedly low and thus keeping activity minimal. Also the arbitrage window between East and West has reopened as the high prices in Asia are creating a surge of Btd into Asia.
Time Charter Fixtures
Jenny N (60,000 cbm, blt 2009) was reportedly fixed for 6 months T/C to acct Petredec with del USG / Mid Aug – hnr
Clipper Venus (60,000 cbm, blt 2015) was reportedly fixed for 2 years T/C to acct Koch with delivery ex yard Korea / Aug – hnr
Sale and Purchase/New Buildings
None Reported.
Scrapping
Eratan (24,000 cbm, fully ref, blt 1983) was reportedly sold for scrap with del as is Singapore – pnr
